speaker: Skyline
text: Nothing Happens.  _ACT 1  Scene 1 - Radio Station. Frasier is finishing with a caller._

speaker: Frasier
text: Terrence, I'm afraid we're nearing the end of our program, and we still haven't gotten to the heart of your problem.

speaker: Terrence
text: Well, uh, I guess I'm just sick of being single.  I mean, I'm almost forty.  What kind of loser am I?

speaker: Frasier
text: A single man in his forties is not a loser.

speaker: Terrence
text: I said I'm almost forty.  Don't make it worse than it is.

speaker: Roz
text: Can I jump in here, Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Please.

speaker: Roz
text: Listen, Terrence, I know that I'm not as old as you - or Frasier - but I've been through plenty of heartache and loneliness.  I remember thinking: "Love is never going to come to me," so I gave up.  And that is when a handsome, sweet-hearted man named Roger jumped off his garbage truck and into my life.  And I have been deliriously happy ever since, and I feel sure that the same thing will happen for you. _Frasier has rolled his eyes throughout this speech.  Clearly he has heard it before._

speaker: Terrence
text: So I have to give up on love first?

speaker: Roz
text: No, I'm saying don't give up.

speaker: Terrence
text: But you said you met this garbage man after you gave up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Terrence, I think what Roz is trying to say is that whether we seek love or not, we are always at the mercy of its mysterious rhythm.

speaker: Roz
text: Exactly.

speaker: Terrence
text: That's not what she said, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_hanging up_] I think we know why this guy's still single. This is Dr. Frasier Crane saying Good Day, Seattle, and Good Mental Health. _He signs off.  Roz enters from her booth. (It should be noted that she is wearing a necklace with a big silver "R" on its end.)_

speaker: Roz
text: Your dad called during the last segment.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, great.

speaker: Roz
text: There's the number.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  Yes, he's working the early shift today, so we're going to have a dinner together this evening.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm going out to dinner too.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, with Roger.  You mentioned that.

speaker: Roz
text: Did I tell you he's taking me on a moonlight picnic?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, you did.

speaker: Roz
text: In a canoe?

speaker: Frasier
text: Check.

speaker: Roz
text: How romantic is that?  He said all I have to bring is my appetite for caviar and affection.  I told him all he had to bring was his appetite because I'll be wearing my edible...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_interrupting at this fortuitous moment_] Dad, Hi!  Yeah, listen, um, I've made our reservation for... [_aside_] Sorry, Roz.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, hello, is Martin Crane there, please? [_Pause_] Dad, Hi! I made a reservation for, uh, 7:30, so I'll pick you up around 7:15, all right?  Oh.  Oh dear.  Hey, you know what?  Why don't I stop by with a pizza?  Okay, great.  I'll see you then.  Bye.

speaker: Roz
text: More flowers from Roger, and you have to hear this poem he wrote me.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_into phone_] Hang on a second, Dad.  I've got to get a pen. I'll write that down. [_aside_] I'm sorry, Roz. _Roz returns to the booth.  Frasier grabs a pad and pen to continue the charade.  FADE OUT.  Scene 2 - Martin's place of employment as a security guard.  It is the lobby of an office building.  A woman exits the elevator and passes his station._

speaker: Woman
text: ** Good night, Marty!

speaker: Martin
text: See you tomorrow, Babs.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey, Mister, pizza delivery!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, you made it!  Oh, that smells good.  What kind did you get?

speaker: Frasier
text: Prosciutto and Fontina.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I had my heart set on a ham-and-cheese. [_opening the box_] Oh, you were just messing with me!  Good one, Fras! [_They begin to clear the desk._] Uh-oh, my boss is coming.

speaker: Frasier
text: Where?

speaker: Martin
text: I can see him on the monitors.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd love to meet him. _At this point, Martin's boss, Rich Kechner, enters.  He is having a heated conversation on a radio._

speaker: Rich
text: How many times do I have to tell you to stay off this damn frequency!

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, maybe just go read the directory for a minute.

speaker: Rich
text: [_approaching_] Food has to stay out of sight, Crane.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, right. [_He begins to put the box of pizza under the desk._]

speaker: Rich
text: I'll take a slice, though.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, sure.

speaker: Rich
text: [_taking a slice_] Hey, did you notice anyone messing with the camera in the east tower?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah, that was me.  The way it was pointed you couldn't really see the stairs.

speaker: Rich
text: So you left your post?

speaker: Martin
text: I just thought, you know, it made more sense if...

speaker: Rich
text: [_interrupting angrily_] We don't pay you to think, Crane! We pay you to watch the monitors and keep the sign-in sheet in order.

speaker: Rich
text: We also pay you to button the top button of your shirt!

speaker: Man
text: ** See you tomorrow, fellas.

speaker: Martin
text: Good night!

speaker: Rich
text: [_simultaneously_] Good night, now!

speaker: Rich
text: Maybe when you were a cop you could play fast and loose with the rules, but here at Kechner security, regulations have to be followed.

speaker: Martin
text: Yes, sir.  Do you want to look over the sign in sheet? _CUT TO: Frasier.  A man approaches him, observing that he is near the directory._

speaker: Man
text: Do you need any help?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, I-I'm sorry, no.  No, thank you.

speaker: Man
text: You hate to ask for help, huh?  You know what people who never ask questions never get? [_off Frasier's gesture_] Answers.

speaker: Frasier
text: Very interesting.  Yes, um... [_pointing to the directory_] Ah, there it is.  UCB industries.

speaker: Man
text: You're a UCB man?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Man
text: I'm with DNR associates.  So I guess technically, we shouldn't be talking.  But, uh, who takes that corporate competition stuff seriously anymore.

speaker: Frasier
text: I do.

speaker: Man
text: Oh. [_He walks off._]

speaker: Rich
text: Look, Crane, if you really want to put that busy brain of yours to work, why don't you mastermind a way to lift the pizza stain out of your tie?

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't believe the way that guy talked to you!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it's no big deal.  Why don't you just go home?

speaker: Frasier
text: But he has no right to do that!

speaker: Martin
text: Just go home.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.  I'll see you there. _He reluctantly goes to the elevator.  The same businessman is standing there.  They wait._

speaker: Man
text: Well, this is awkward.  Especially with the, uh, Reliance Bearings account up for grabs.  Whoever wins it, wins it. Good luck.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_with obvious enjoyment_] Don't you mean congratulations?

speaker: Man
text: You're kidding!

speaker: Frasier
text: An hour ago.  Don't they ever CC you guys on this stuff? _Frasier enters the arriving elevator.  The man pulls out his cell phone.  Frasier gleefully gestures good-bye to the man as the elevator closes.  FADE TO:_ **THEY HAD TO CLOSE THE EXPRESS LINE** _Scene 3 - Frasier's apartment. Niles and Daphne are seated on the couch.  Frasier is standing._

speaker: Niles
text: You're sure you're not exaggerating?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'll tell you, Niles, I stood there, slack-jawed, as Dad was reprimanded like an errant child!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_serving coffee_] Well maybe his boss was having a tough day and needed someone to take it out on.  You know, sometimes an employer gets so caught up in his own world that he...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_cutting her off, increasingly indignant_] I mean, after all, this is a man who served his country in Korea, who had a distinguished career as a detective, and yet he is being treated the way you [_indicating Niles_] would treat a grocery store bag boy!

speaker: Niles
text: What does that mean?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, don't you play coy with me just because Daphne's here. I have seen you when your avocados are packed under your ice cream.

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me, that young man was on drugs and everyone in the store knew it!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, guys.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad.

speaker: Daphne
text: Mr. Crane.  How was work today?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, same old, same old.  Boy, I'm beat.

speaker: Martin
text: Eight hours of staring at those monitors can really wear you out. _As he turns on the TV, the others comment visually on the irony of that statement._

speaker: Frasier
text: So, Dad, did you speak with your supervisor?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, don't start this again.  Everything's fine.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on, Dad, after the way that man eviscerated you?

speaker: Martin
text: That's just Rich.  He's one of those tough guys.  It's no big deal.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're a tough guy yourself.  Why didn't you set him straight?

speaker: Martin
text: I'm not going to talk back to my boss.  You have to respect the chain of command.  It's not always easy, but that's the way I've always done it.

speaker: Frasier
text: So you're just going to sit there and take it?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on, Fras.  Now, we're men.  We know how to gut these things out.  We don't whine and cry.  You know that.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_disparagingly_] Ha! [_All three of them stare at her._] H... How true.  You do know that, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I'll bet the owner of the company would like to know how this Rich is behaving.

speaker: Martin
text: The owner of the company is Rich's son.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nepotism, huh?  Golly, this problem just keeps getting bigger and bigger.

speaker: Martin
text: It's not a problem!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier!  Would you listen?  He said it's not a problem. I'm sure Dad's more than capable of handling himself.

speaker: Martin
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: See, he thinks you're completely out of line.

speaker: Martin
text: No, I just...

speaker: Niles
text: [_interrupting_] No, Dad, Dad. I got this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, you've got to have at least some kind of plan to deal with this guy.

speaker: Martin
text: I've got a plan.  Once Rich knows I'm not fighting, he'll drop it, which is what you guys are going to do.  Now I'm tired of talking about this.

speaker: Niles
text: See, now you've mad Dad tired.

speaker: Martin
text: Can it, Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: And cranky. _FADE TO:  Scene 4 - Cafe Nervosa. Frasier is seated.  A man enters, seeking him.  It is Charlie Kechner, the owner of the security company._

speaker: Charlie
text: Frasier Crane, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, yes.

speaker: Charlie
text: I'm Charlie Kechner of Kechner Security. [_They shake hands._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Mr. Kechner, nice to meet you.  Please sit down. Would you like some coffee?

speaker: Charlie
text: Nothing for me, thanks.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd like to thank you for meeting me like this.

speaker: Charlie
text: No problem.  I like face-to-facing with new clients - especially those in the public eye who need the kind of custom-tailored security that we specialize in.  So, what is it?  Stalker, blackmailer, random nut job?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, but I'm not actually... in the market for security services.

speaker: Charlie
text: Well that's strange. [_reaching into his jacket pocket and pulling out a paper_] Because your phone message said "I'm in the market for security services."

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I can see how that may have been misleading.  I, um... I wanted to meet you in person because I have a...a matter of some delicacy to discuss with you.  You see, my father works for your company, and I understand your father does as well

speaker: Charlie
text: What does this have to do with anything?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it seems that... your dad has been picking on my dad.

speaker: Charlie
text: [_puzzled_] What?  That doesn't sound like my dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, perhaps you don't know your dad as well as you think you do.  I saw the whole thing.

speaker: Charlie
text: Well, maybe my dad was just defending himself.  Did your dad provoke him?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no.  I can assure you that your dad started it.

speaker: Charlie
text: None of the other guards has any trouble with my dad.  Maybe your dad just needs to toughen up a little.

speaker: Frasier
text: My father fought in Korea.

speaker: Charlie
text: Did he?  Or did you fight the Koreans for him?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_who has no response for this_] Now, Charlie, I'm sure a man of your inspired leadership has resolved conflicts between employees before.

speaker: Charlie
text: Sure.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's that kind of enlightened management that has made the name Kechner synonymous with security.

speaker: Charlie
text: All right.  I'll look into it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you. [_They rise._] Thank you so much.  Oh, and if you don't mind, could we keep this meeting between us?  I'd hate to have my father think that I went behind his back.

speaker: Charlie
text: You're asking me to conceal something from my own father? I don't know if I can do that.  On the other hand, if you were a client, I'd be obligated to keep this confidential.

speaker: Frasier
text: If you're implying what I think you are, Mr. Kechner, I hope, for your sake, you brought some brochures.  Please... _They sit.  Charlie opens his briefcase.  FADE TO:  Scene 5 - The office building lobby. Martin is at his desk.  Rich and some others exit the elevator._

speaker: Rich
text: Good night.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Rich.

speaker: Rich
text: Hey, Buddy!  Everything all right here?

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, sure.

speaker: Rich
text: Nothing to complain about then?

speaker: Martin
text: No.  Want some coffee?

speaker: Rich
text: No, no, no.  I keep my eating and drinking to the break room. That way, nobody...complains.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay.  Uh, I could use your initials on my time card if you've got a sec.

speaker: Rich
text: Oh, for you, I've got all night.  I'll be sure to do it neatly, so there'll be no complaints. [_He hands back the time card, smiling insincerely._]

speaker: Martin
text: Okay, what's going on?

speaker: Rich
text: You tell me.  My son chewed me out for being too tough on the guards.  Now I wonder who might have put him up to that?

speaker: Martin
text: Could have been any of the guys?

speaker: Rich
text: I think it was _you_!

speaker: Martin
text: It wasn't me.  I'm not a complainer.

speaker: Rich
text: Good.  Then you won't complain about doing a few graveyard shifts next week?

speaker: Martin
text: No problem.

speaker: Rich
text: Good.  How's Tuesday, Wednesday work for you?

speaker: Martin
text: Actually, that's not so good.

speaker: Rich
text: Oh? [_with increasing anger_] Then how's Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday?

speaker: Martin
text: [_stoically_] Better. _FADE OUT  END OF ACT 1  ACT 2  Scene 6 - Cafe Nervosa. Niles and Daphne are seated.  Roz enters and approaches them._

speaker: Roz
text: Hey Niles!  Hey Daphne...

speaker: Niles
text: Hey Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: I called you this morning.  Where were you?

speaker: Daphne
text: Sleeping.  Mr. Crane's been working the overnight shift. It's thrown my whole schedule off.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh.  Roger and I have been working overnight too, if you know what I mean.  Let me grab a muffin and I'll tell you all about it.

speaker: Niles
text: Grab one for me too.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay.

speaker: Niles
text: So I can stick it in my ears.  I'm just a little tired of hearing about it.

speaker: Daphne
text: _You're_ tired?  I've heard double whatever you have. Did you know Roger wrote her a song to the tune of "I Believe I Can Fly?"

speaker: Niles
text: I do now, don't I?  Look, let's just not talk about Roger this one time, okay.

speaker: Daphne
text: That's impossible.  She brings everything back to him.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, just leave it to me.

speaker: Daphne
text: Good luck.

speaker: Roz
text: [_returning_] So what are you guys talking about?

speaker: Niles
text: Um, medieval French history.

speaker: Roz
text: I've always wanted to see Paris.

speaker: Niles
text: Mm-hmm.  Thank you.

speaker: Roz
text: Roger says he's going to take me there someday.  He says you haven't truly made love...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, look at this.

speaker: Roz
text: What?

speaker: Niles
text: It says interest rates might go down again.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, just when we thought the interest couldn't get any lower.

speaker: Roz
text: I don't know about interest rates and all that garbage... [_correcting herself_] Oops.  It's a good thing Roger didn't hear that.  He doesn't like it when I use "garbage" in a derogatory way. [_Niles and Daphne exchange glances._] Of course, he always forgives me.  Isn't he a doll?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you know, speaking of dolls, I understand that the Nordic Heritage Museum is planning a huge retrospective of Icelandic dolls of the 19th century.

speaker: Roz
text: Hmm, is the Nordic Museum the one near Sunset Hill? Because Roger and I had the best bottle of wine there...

speaker: Niles
text: No.  The Nordic Museum is in Ballard.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh.  I guess I don't know that place after all.

speaker: Daphne
text: That exhibit sounds fascinating, Niles.  When is it?

speaker: Niles
text: February 14th.

speaker: Roz
text: Valentine's Day?  I guess I won't be there.  Roger and I are spending the whole day together.  He says it's going to be full of romantic surprises.  I mean, but he gives me, like, a romantic surprise every single day...

speaker: Niles
text: [_interrupting_] Oh, well, I know girl talk when I hear it. Excuse me.

speaker: Roz
text: Girl talk?  He's the one going to a doll museum. _Frasier has entered over the previous dialogue.  He is now sitting nearer the window than Roz, Daphne, and Niles.  Niles quickly approaches him._

speaker: Niles
text: Forget your coffee.  Let's get out of here.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  And leave Daphne?

speaker: Niles
text: It's too late for her.  We have to keep moving.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I can't.  I'm meeting Dad here in a few minutes. His schedule's been so topsy-turvy lately, I haven't seen him in days.

speaker: Niles
text: [_sitting_] Is he still having trouble with his supervisor?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes, yes, but I believe we'll be hearing some good news on that front.  No thanks to you.

speaker: Niles
text: What does that mean?

speaker: Frasier
text: Let's just say I took appropriate action.

speaker: Niles
text: After Dad asked you to butt out?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, Niles, but if you had seen the way this man treated Dad, you would have done the same thing.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, perhaps.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: I just wonder if you're doing this for Dad or for yourself.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, what are you on about now?

speaker: Niles
text: I just think it's telling that the whole thing bothers you a lot more than it bothers Dad.  You can't stand to see him being bossed because to you he's always been this larger-than- life figure, and you're desperate to keep that image intact. More importantly, why is that man staring at us? _We see a hulking man in a jacket and turtleneck sitting behind them and watching them._

speaker: Frasier
text: That's Sanchez, my bodyguard. [_Niles glances back at Sanchez._] It's only on a trial basis.  It's a long story.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!  How are you doing?

speaker: Martin
text: I'm mad as hell, that's how I'm doing!

speaker: Martin
text: I just got beeped.  Rich wants me to work tonight.  I'm going to have to cancel our dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: You haven't had a day off in a week!

speaker: Martin
text: I know, but apparently he thinks I went over his head to complain about him, so now he's really turning up the heat.

speaker: Niles
text: No kidding! [_staring at Frasier_] As if things weren't bad enough for you already, Dad. [_Frasier glares at Niles._]

speaker: Martin
text: I used to take a lot of pride in working through tough spots like this, but I don't know if it's worth it this time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I'm so sorry.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it's nobody's fault.  I'm just getting too old for this sort of stuff.  If he keeps up with it, I'm just going to call it quits.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, that's a horrible idea.  You can't run away from these kinds of problems.  I mean, it only encourages the torment. [_Martin begins to leave._] Where are you going?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I'm going to grab a quick nap before my shift starts.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm trying to help you decide what to do.

speaker: Martin
text: I know, that's what reminded me to take a nap. [_He leaves._]

speaker: Niles
text: Well done, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.  My plan backfired.  I guess there's only one option left.

speaker: Niles
text: Tell Dad the truth.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, two options. [_Niles looks at him expectantly._] I've got to go to the source this time and speak directly to Rich.

speaker: Niles
text: Don't you ever learn?

speaker: Frasier
text: He needs to know that Dad is not the one who complained about him.  All right, I'll tell you what, Niles, why don't you come with me?  The two of us can help him together.

speaker: Niles
text: Forget it, you know how I feel about this.  You're on your own.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Niles_] Good news, dear!  Roz is going to join us for shopping today.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no, I just promised Frasier I'd help him with something.

speaker: Roz
text: You know what Roger says is the most erotic organ?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_hopefully_] The mind?

speaker: Roz
text: [_laughing_] No! **IT'S CONFIRMED...THEY'RE IN THE CLOSET** _Scene 7 - The office building lobby. Frasier and Niles enter._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well he's not even here!  I can't believe this.  I mean, after the way he came down on Dad for doing the very same thing.  I tell you, Niles, I am not by nature a violent man, but I swear, if I have to, I will page Sanchez.

speaker: Niles
text: [_leading Frasier away_] I think you need to calm down.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, you're right.  I came here to talk to the man. Still the blood runs hot!

speaker: Frasier
text: That's him!  That's him!

speaker: Rich
text: Let me ask you something.  They pay you to fix the elevator or just spread your tools all over my lobby? [_He kicks the toolbox._] You ever hear of putting down a drop cloth!

speaker: Niles
text: You know, by letting Dad handle this himself, you'd be empowering him, and isn't that the greatest gift of all?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Niles, I came down here to stand up to that man.  The time for running away has passed. [_Martin's voice is heard._] Dad's here!  Oh, God, we can't let him see us!  Come on!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Rich.

speaker: Rich
text: Hey, Crane, you're early.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I thought I'd get a head start on the checkpoints.

speaker: Rich
text: Well, la-de-da.

speaker: Niles
text: Great.  Now what?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Dad says he makes his rounds every 20 minutes.  We'll just wait till the next one and then slip out then.

speaker: Rich
text: Oh, what's this?

speaker: Martin
text: What's what?

speaker: Rich
text: There's two guys in the storage room. [_grabbing his club_] Stay here!  I'll take care of it.

speaker: Martin
text: [_looking at the monitor_] No, No!

speaker: Rich
text: Why not?

speaker: Martin
text: Those are my kids.

speaker: Rich
text: Well, what the hell are they doing in the storage room?

speaker: Martin
text: I don't know, but knowing them, they probably came down here to fight my battle for me.

speaker: Rich
text: What battle?

speaker: Martin
text: With you.  They know we don't get along.

speaker: Rich
text: Wait a minute!  They wouldn't be the ones who complained about me, would they?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I wouldn't be surprised.  They're always sticking their noses into my business.

speaker: Rich
text: Sounds like my kid.  He thinks just because I work for him he's my boss. [_Martin shakes his head._]

speaker: Niles
text: Can you hear anything?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, but I guarantee you Rich is being a jerk.  You know, I wish Dad would just tell this guy off.

speaker: Niles
text: And that would make Dad feel better?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I don't know.  But it'd make me feel a lot better.

speaker: Niles
text: So, this _is_ all about you.

speaker: Frasier
text: To some extent.  All right, to a great extent.  It's just that all our lives, Dad's been the guy in charge.  I just hate to see him powerless like this.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, how can you call him powerless?  The minute you saw him, you ran into a storage closet.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's true.

speaker: Niles
text: You're a grown man.  You're still scared of him.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're a grown man.  You're still scared of him, too.

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, well, at least I have a girlfriend.

speaker: Frasier
text: Shut up!

speaker: Niles
text: [_sniffing_] Do you smell ammonia?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Niles
text: What is that?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_indicating_] Ammonia. _Niles sniffs and curls his lip in disgust.  CUT BACK TO: Martin and Rich, who are now sitting amiably in conversation behind the desk._

speaker: Martin
text: The thing fell 19 stories and landed right in front of me on the sidewalk.  [_N.B. For this story, see the episode[[9.07]](/frasier/transcripts/season_9/episode_7/bla_z_boy.html "Bla-Z-Boy")"Bla-Z-Boy," where Frasier accidentally sends Martin's chair crashing to the ground from the balcony._]

speaker: Rich
text: [_laughing_] That's nothing.  My kid ran over my foot while I was sweeping the driveway. [_They both laugh._]

speaker: Martin
text: You know, the scary thing is, that generation's going to be running the country one of these days.

speaker: Rich
text: Not as long as I'm voting, Marty.

speaker: Martin
text: Ain't that the truth.  What are the geniuses doing now?

speaker: Rich
text: One of them's down there trying to breathe through the crack under the door. _We see Niles doing this on the monitor, and then CUT TO the closet itself._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sake, Niles, get up, there's plenty of air! _Niles slowly rises.  Frasier's cell phone rings.  Niles gestures to Frasier, who nervously answers the phone._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_in a strained whisper_] Hello?

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras, it's me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, hi! _CUT TO: Lobby Martin is holding out the receiver, and we see that Rich is listening to the conversation._

speaker: Martin
text: Why are you whispering?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm in a very quiet restaurant.  Yes, I'll have the pan- seared ahi with the ginger-mushroom cream sauce, and-and for a starter, I'd like the sesame-tempura string beans.

speaker: Niles
text: [_imitating a waiter_] And for the lady?

speaker: Frasier
text: Shut up! _The two of them stand, at a loss what to do next.  We CUT TO: Martin and Rich laughing hysterically._

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry about that, Dad!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no problem!

speaker: Frasier
text: So, Dad, when are you starting your rounds?

speaker: Martin
text: I don't know.  Let me ask. [_to Rich_] Uh, Rich, should I start my rounds now?

speaker: Rich
text: [_feigning anger_] You'd like that, wouldn't you?  You're staying here! _Rich's outburst startles Frasier.  He and Martin find all of this hysterical._

speaker: Martin
text: Hear that, Fras?  No rounds.  Guess I'm just stuck here at the desk for five hours.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_crestfallen_] Tough break.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'll see you later. _They hang up.  Frasier shrugs his shoulders at Niles, who also has no solution for the problem.  We FADE OUT on the view of them in the closet.  END OF ACT 2_
